comment: I had her for lab and she was amazing! I plan on taking her for lecture in the summer. The lab quizzes are online and she goes over the procedure the first 20 mins of class so get there on time.

I took her for MICROBIO LAB. very easy prof, she's very caring she has about 8 labs. graded based on labs and pre labs(about 2-5 questions each) very easy, very lenient with grading, make sure you attend class and ask questions and you'll pass

Professor Harkins is an amazing teacher and kind person. Probably the first prof I have had at KSU that really wanted everyone to succeed. She very clearly tells you what learning objectives to study and prepares you well for the exams. Overall she is the best choice for micro.

I love Professor Harkins. Her lectures are great, and you get random participation extra credit just for showing up. Homework is all pretty easy if you follow instructions, and exams aren't bad at all if you study.
Class is crazy easy. Really nice and is very clear on what is going to be on her exams. Lots of extra credit opportunities just by showing up. Her lectures are pretty good.

Honestly a sweetheart. She tests mainly off the learning objectives and the homeworks feel relevant to her tests too. She provides opportunity for extra credit just based on random attendance days, but you can kinda show up whenever is convenient and still be very successful in this class. She also provides good review games before the test

TAKE HER!!! Had her for lecture & lab. Lecture was not mandatory but lab was. For lecture the tests were online with lockdown/webcam also used connect HW and quizzes. Lab consisted of pre-lab quizzes, labs, midterm, 1 extra credit assignment, and final exam. She is very understanding and caring, you just have to apply yourself and you'll do great!

I sadly did not have her for lecture, but she was my lab professor and this is hands down my favorite lab I have taken. Shes very understanding and can explain everything very easily to you. If you have questions shes available and will walkthrough it with you. SHE SHOULD BE UR FIRST CHOICE, even if the class is in the late afternoon IT IS WORTH IT
LOVE HER! She makes tests super easy to understand. Tests are at home with lockdown and webcam, and quizzes and hw are through connect. Definitely recommend taking her!

Dr. Harkins is the best. If you're taking microbio for the nursing track, sign up for her! 

Attendance isn't mandatory.  Tests are pretty easy. Class was pretty great TBH.

She is a wonderful professor that cares about her students. This class can be difficult since it is an upper level science course, but she makes it 10x better by making sure we always learn what we need to know. She provides outlines of her lectures as well as learning objectives that help you a lot for her tests.

Dr. Harkins was such a great professor. She makes the content/tests easy to understand. Her stories that she tells in class helped me to remember a lot too. She is a very fair teacher and is understanding with due dates and taking questions off of tests if it is missed by a lot of students. Definitely take her for this course!!

TAKE HER! HW for each chapter. 4 tests, 5th test is final, it's comprehensive. This is the easiest science class I've ever taken. She gives a bunch of extra credit. If you study & put forth the work you can easily make an A! She can get sidetracked a lot, but it worked in our favor where some of the test didn't even have all the chapters. 10/10!!
She is super sweet, and her lectures and tests are very easy. Not too much homework, and attendance was not mandatory.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I learn best when I hear something, so that was the only reason I would go to classes. She definitely gets off topic a lot, but her test are not hard at all. Test are given at home. They do have lockdown browser and camera, but the homework and quizzes are worth enough that if you make a bad grade on one or two test you should still be fine.
Dr. Harkins is the best professor to take for Micro both for lecture and lab. There are opportunities for extra credit. Very nice and wants everyone to do well in her class.

I loved her lab course for microbiology. She's passionate about what she does and will help you along the way. As long as you understand the reviews she gives for the midterm and final practical, you'll pass. Al the information you need, she will provide. It'll be crazy not to pass her class.
I had her for lab and she is absolutely amazing! Wish I had taken her for lecture as well. The best micro teacher here, Take her!

I had her for lab and YOU WANT HER FOR LAB AND LECTURE! compared to the other prof. shes a GOD SEND! she is so caring and wants her students to do well. Get her if you can! Lab was super easy and she made it so fun

I was genuinely surprised by the other reviews. Dr. Harkins is the best prof you can take for this course. She tells you EXACTLY what you need to know for the exams and provides a study guide for you. Has an ample amount of extra credit. For example, you only have to do 75% of the hw and the rest is extra credit. Above all, she is very kind!

I'm not sure why so many people didn't like her as a teacher, she is very nice and knows her stuff in the profession. She was good at relating it to real-world scenarios. Microbiology is a content-heavy course so be prepared to study, but she lays out exactly the content she wants you to know for tests and even provides study guides and reviews.

Attendance not mandatory, but attendance quizzes on some days were extra credit. Tests were online with lockdown browser. Textbook required because homework and quizzes are done through Pearson. I took her for fall 2022 and it was her first semester at KSU, so she'll probably settle and get better.

Nice person, not great prof. Her powerpoints were incomplete and messy. Rewrote her schedule throughout the whole semester. Updated her grade point scale the last week of class. The first test was an easy A, the rest took a lot of studying. Had all of the Pearson HW due at the end of the semester. Heard shes a lot better for lab than lecture.

To me she was a pretty good professor. There was some time where it gets confusing on what she wants, but I just think it is because she is new here. There was a lot of homework and groupwork sometimes, but it is all doable. The tests are all online with lockdown + camera, and we had a quiz for every "unit". The better option for this class

Be prepared to teach yourself as she would read directly off of the PowerPoints without much input. Harkins would ask questions on her tests that were not on the study guide. She would also waste time by covering chapters that she said we would not be tested on, instead of reviewing the material we would be tested on.

Overall, not a great teacher. She was very unorganized and just read off the powerpoint during class. Some concepts would be on the study guide, but she would say we don't have to know that stuff when someone asked. Very unclear grading criteria at first because she's bad at explaining. Randomly takes participation for extra credit.

Professor Harkins was OK. Not bad, not amazing, but OK. She changed her syllabus several times during the semester, she read directly off the slides with no real additional insight, and she wasn't necessarily engaging. But, the exams are online at home, her grading criteria is fair, and without much effort, I made an A. So I do recommend her.

Professor Harkins was not very organized. Her syllabus changed multiple times and she taught several unneccesary chapters. The tests are online which is nice but there is an insane ammount of homework. She is nice, you just don't learn a lot from her lectures in my opinion.

Get ready to teach yourself. The PowerPoints she uses were not created by her and it shows. The mountains of hw also don't correlate with anything on the test. She is also very scattered. I will say to her credit she is very nice.
